assumedRoleArn.description: ARN of the role created for LogicMonitor to use while monitoring AWS

billingBucketName.description: S3 bucket name that houses AWS billing info (deprecated)

billingPathPrefix.description: Path to billing info in billing bucket (deprecated)

collectorId.description: ID of the collector assigned to this group

externalId.description: External ID provide by LM for the creation of the assumed role in AWS

schedule.description:
The NetScan schedule for how frequently the cloud collector should scan/discover new resources in the cloud account. It's format is similar to Linux crontab but doesn't support some complex representations ('-', '/', ',') supported in standard linux crontabs.
Format: '*(minute) *(hour) *(day) *(week of month) *(weekday)'
Examples: '50 * * * *' means scheduling at 50th minute per hour
'50 10 20 * *' means scheduling at 10:50 of the 20th day per month
'50 10 * 1 3' means scheduling at wednesday of the first week per month

account.description: cloud account information (currently only supports AWS)

devices.description: Cloud devices to monitor in the group

appliesTo.description: AppliesTo expression to match or filter device

autoBalancedCollectorGroupId.description: Auto balanced collector group id assigned to ec2 or azure vm

collectorId.description: Normal collector ID assigned to ec2 or azure vm

priority.description: Collector match priority, smaller value has higher priority

usePublicIP.description: Use cloud device public ip or not

deviceType.description: Cloud device type (2 for AWS Device)

collectors.description: List of settings which apply to the real collectors being used to monitor cloud resources

enabled.description: If the normal collector config is enabled

customNSPSchedule.description:
The NetScan schedule for how frequently the cloud collector should scan/discover new resources in the cloud account. It's format is similar to Linux crontab but doesn't support some complex representations ('-', '/', ',') supported in standard linux crontabs.
Format: '*(minute) *(hour) *(day) *(week of month) *(weekday)'
Examples: '50 * * * *' means scheduling at 50th minute per hour
'50 10 20 * *' means scheduling at 10:50 of the 20th day per month
'50 10 * 1 3' means scheduling at wednesday of the first week per month

deadOperation.description: How to handle dead cloud devices (deletion from monitoring). Valid options include MANUALLY, IMMEDIATELY, KEEP_1_DAY, KEEP_3_DAYS, KEEP_7_DAYS, KEEP_14_DAYS, and KEEP_30_DAYS

deviceDisplayNameTemplate.description: Template used to name devices found within the cloud account within the LM portal

disableStopTerminateHostMonitor.description: If monitoring of stopped/terminated hosts is disabled

disableTerminatedHostAlerting.description: If alerting should be disabled when a cloud device is terminated

monitoringRegionInfos.description: The regions this group will monitor

monitoringRegions.description: The regions this group will monitor

nameFilter.description: Filter to determine which cloud devices should be monitored based on the device name

normalCollectorConfig.description: Configuration of 'normal' collector installed to the cloud (ie an EC2 instance)

selectAll.description: Whether or not to use all regions (can be used instead of monitoringRegions and monitoringRegionInfos)

tags.description: Tags used to filter whether or not a cloud device is included in this group

useDefault.description: Whether or not to use the default settings for this service. When set to true in a Service's settings, all other fields will be ignored

name.description: The name of the device property that this filter will appy to (i.e. system.aws.tag.os). Case sensitive for AWS resources

operation.description: The operation that determines how this filter will be applied (options are 'exclude' or 'include')

value.description: The glob expression that the filter will match on

ackComment.description: The comment associated with the Collector acknowledgement (if it is in alert and acknowledged)

acked.description: Whether or not the Collector is currently acknowledged

ackedBy.description: The user that acknowledged the Collector (if it is in alert)

ackedOn.description: The epoch at which the Collector was acknowledged (if it is in alert)

ackedOnLocal.description: The time that the Collector was acknowledged (if it is in alert), in local time format

arch.description: The collector architecture (Windows | Linux platform followed by 32 | 64 bit)

automaticUpgradeInfo.description: The details of the Collector's automatic upgrade schedule, if one exists

backupAgentId.description: The Id of the backup Collector assigned to the Collector

canDowngrade.description: Whether the collector can be downgraded to a lower version

canDowngradeReason.description: The reason why the collector can be downgraded

clearSent.description: Whether or not an alert clear notifcation has been sent for this Collector

collectorDeviceId.description: The device id of the collector device

collectorGroupId.description: The Id of the group the Collector is in

collectorGroupName.description: The name of the group the Collector is in

company.description: The user's company (portal) name, this field is required if the environment variable LM_COMPANY is not set

confVersion.description: The version of the agent.conf configuration file

createdOn.description: The time that the Collector was created, in epoch format

createdOnLocal.description: The time that the Collector was created, in local time format

customProperties.description: The custom properties defined for the Collector

ea.description: Whether the collector is in EA version

enableFailBack.description: Whether or not automatic failback is enabled for the Collector, the default value is true

enableFailOverOnCollectorDevice.description: Whether or not the device the Collector is installed on is enabled for fail over

escalatingChainId.description: The Id of the escalation chain associated with this Collector

hasFailOverDevice.description: Whether the collector has failover devices

hostname.description: The hostname of the device the Collector is installed on

inSDT.description: The SDT status of the collector

installer_url_cmds.description: A map of the collector urls and (if linux) commands to download the collector installer

isDown.description: Whether or not the Collector is currently down

lastSentNotificationOn.description: The time, in epoch format, that a notification was last sent for the Collector

lastSentNotificationOnLocal.description: The time that a notification was last sent for this Collector, in local time format

monitorOthers.description: Check if we shall monitor using local account (for windows)

needAutoCreateCollectorDevice.description: Whether to create a collector device when instance collector, the default value is true

netscanVersion.description: The Netscan version associated with the Collector

nextRecipient.description: The Id of the next recipient to which alert notifications will be sent

nextUpgradeInfo.description: The details of the Collector's next upgrade, if one has been scheduled

numberOfHosts.description: The number of devices monitored by the Collector

numberOfInstances.description: The number of instances that are monitored by this collector

numberOfWebsites.description: The number of websites monitored by the Collector

onetimeDowngradeInfo.description: The details of the Collector's automatic downgrade schedule, if one exists

onetimeUpgradeInfo.description: The details of the Collector's one time upgrade, if one has been scheduled

platform.description: The OS of the Collector device (e.g. Linux, Windows)

previousVersion.description: The previous version of the collector, used for downgrading

resendIval.description: The interval, in minutes, after which alert notifications for the Collector will be resent

specifiedCollectorDeviceGroupId.description: The collector device group id assigned when creating a new collector device

status.description: The registration status of the Collector. Acceptable values are: 0= unregistered, 1= registered, 2= stopped, 3= suspended

suppressAlertClear.description: Whether alert clear notifications are suppressed for the Collector

upTime.description: The time the Collector has been up, in seconds

updatedOn.description: The time that the Collector was last updated, in epoch format

updatedOnLocal.description: The time that the Collector was last updated, in local time format

userChangeOn.description: The last time the Collector was updated, in epoch format

userChangeOnLocal.description: The last time the Collector was updated, in the account time zone

userPermission.description: The permission level of the user that made the API request to get Collector information

userVisibleHostsNum.description: The number of devices monitored by the Collector and visible to the user that made the query

userVisibleWebsitesNum.description: The number of websites monitored by the Collector and visible to the user that made the query

watchdogUpdatedOn.description: The time that the Watchdog Services was last updated, in epoch format

watchdogUpdatedOnLocal.description: The time that the Collector Watchdog was last updated, in local time format

websiteConf.description: Whether or not the device the Collector is installed on is enabled for fail over

acked.description: Whether or not the Collector is currently acknowledged

ackedBy.description: The user that acknowledged the Collector (if it is in alert)

ackedOn.description: The epoch at which the Collector was acknowledged (if it is in alert)

ackedOnLocal.description: The time that the Collector was acknowledged (if it is in alert), in local time format

resendIval.description: The interval, in minutes, after which alert notifications for the Collector will be resent

specifiedCollectorDeviceGroupId.description: The device group id when create a new collector device

status.description: The registration status of the Collector. Acceptable values are: 0= unregistered, 1= registered, 2= stopped, 3= suspended

suppressAlertClear.description: Whether alert clear notifications are suppressed for the Collector

upTime.description: The time the Collector has been up, in seconds

updatedOn.description: The time that the Collector was last updated, in epoch format

updatedOnLocal.description: The time that the Collector was last updated, in local time format

watchdogUpdatedOn.description: The time that the Watchdog Services was last updated, in epoch format

watchdogUpdatedOnLocal.description: The time that the Collector Watchdog was last updated, in local time format

autoBalance.description: Denotes whether or not the collector group should be auto balanced

autoBalanceInstanceCountThreshold.description: Threshold for instance count strategy to check if a collector has high load

createOn.description: The time at which the group was created, in epoch format

customProperties.description: The custom properties defined for the Collector group

description.description: The description of the Collector Group
description.example: Group for collectors dedicated to Network Devices

id.description: The id of the Collector Group

name.description: The name of the Collector Group

numOfCollectors.description: The number of Collectors that belong to the group

userPermission.description: The permission level of the user that made the API request

autoBalancedCollectorGroupId.description: The Auto Balanced Collector Group id. 0 means not monitored by ABCG

autoProperties.description: Any auto properties assigned to the device

autoPropsAssignedOn.description: The time, in epoch seconds format, that properties were first discovered for this device

autoPropsUpdatedOn.description: The time, in epoch seconds, that auto properties last ran and updated the properties table for this device

awsState.description: The AWS instance state (if applicable): 1 indicates that the instance is running, 2 indicates that the instance is stopped and 3 the instance is terminated

azureState.description: The GCP instance state (if applicable): 1 indicates that the instance is running, 2 indicates that the instance is stopped and 3 the instance is terminated.

collectorDescription.description: The description/name of the collector for this device

createdOn.description: The time, in epoch seconds format, that the device was added to your LogicMonitor account

currentCollectorId.description: The id of the collector currently monitoring the device and discovering instances

customProperties.description: Any non-system properties (aside from system.categories) defined for this device

deletedTimeInMs.description: The time in milliseconds that the device has been dead for, or since the AWS device was filtered out

deviceType.description: The type of device: 0 indicates a regular device, 2 indicates an AWS device, 4 indicates an Azure device

disableAlerting.description: Indicates whether alerting is disabled (true) or enabled (false) for this device

displayName.description: The display name of the device

enableNetflow.description: Indicates whether Netflow is enabled (true) or disabled (false) for the device

gcpState.description: The Azure instance state (if applicable): 1 indicates that the instance is running, 2 indicates that the instance is stopped and 3 the instance is terminated.

hostGroupIds.description: The Id(s) of the groups the device is in, where multiple group ids are comma separated

hostStatus.description: The status of this device, where possible statuses are normal, dead and dead-collector

lastDataTime.description: The last time, in epoch seconds, that the device received Netflow data

lastRawdataTime.description: The last time, in epoch seconds, that raw Netflow data was reported

link.description: The URL link associated with the device

name.description: The host name or IP address of the device

netflowCollectorDescription.description: The description/name of the netflow collector for this device

netflowCollectorGroupId.description: The id of the Collector Group associated with the device's netflow collector

netflowCollectorGroupName.description: The name of the Collector Group associated with the device's netflow collector

netflowCollectorId.description: The Id of the netflow collector associated with the device

preferredCollectorGroupId.description: The id of the Collector Group associated with the device's preferred collector

preferredCollectorGroupName.description: The name of the Collector Group associated with the device's preferred collector

preferredCollectorId.description: The Id of the preferred collector assigned to monitor the device

relatedDeviceId.description: The Id of the AWS EC2 instance related to this device, if one exists in the LogicMonitor account. This value defaults to -1, which indicates that there are no related devices

scanConfigId.description: The Id of the netscan configuration which was used to discover this device. 0 indicates that the device was not discovered by a scan

systemProperties.description: Any system properties (aside from system.categories) defined for this device

toDeleteTimeInMs.description: The number of milliseconds until the device will be automatically deleted from your LogicMonitor account (a value of zero indicates that a future delete time/date has not been scheduled)

upTimeInSeconds.description:
The uptime of the device in seconds. This value will always be the largest value reported by the following datasources:
Host Uptime-
SNMPUptime-
SNMP_Engine_Uptime-
WinSystemUptime-
NimbleUptime-

updatedOn.description: The time, in epoch seconds format, that the device was last updated

userPermission.description: The read and/or write permissions for this device that are granted to the user who made the API request

appliesTo.description: The Applies to custom query for this group (only for dynamic groups)

awsRegionsInfo.description: The number of instances in each AWS region (only applies to AWS groups)

awsTestResult.description: The String result returned by the transaction that tests the AWS credentials associated with the AWS group

awsTestResultCode.description: The Status code result returned by the transaction that tests the AWS credentials associated with the AWS group

azureRegionsInfo.description: The number of instances in each Azure region (only applies to Azure groups)

azureTestResult.description: The String result returned by the transaction that tests the Azure credentials associated with the Azure group

azureTestResultCode.description: The Status code result returned by the transaction that tests the Azure credentials associated with the Azure group

createdOn.description: The time, in epoch seconds format, that the device group was created

customProperties.description: The properties associated with this device group

defaultCollectorDescription.description: The description of the default collector assigned to the device group

defaultCollectorId.description: The Id of the default collector assigned to the device group

description.description: The description of the device group

disableAlerting.description: Indicates whether alerting is disabled (true) or enabled (false) for this device group

effectiveAlertEnabled.description: Whether or not alerting is effectively disabled for this device group (alerting may be disabled at a higher level, e.g. parent group)

enableNetflow.description: Indicates whether Netflow is enabled (true) or disabled (false) for the device group, the default value is true

extra.description: The extra setting for cloud group

fullPath.description: The full path of the device group (i.e. if the group 'Dev' is under a parent group named 'Production', the fullPath would be 'Production/Dev'

gcpTestResult.description: The result returned by the transaction that tests the GCP credentials associated with the GCP group

gcpTestResultCode.description: The Status code result returned by the transaction that tests the GCP credentials associated with the GCP group

groupStatus.description:
normal | dead 
The status of this device group, where possible statuses are normal and dead. A group with a status of dead may indicate that one or more devices are dead within the group

groupType.description: The type of device group: normal and dynamic device groups will have groupType=Normal, and AWS groups will have a groupType value of AWS/SERVICE (e.g. AWS/AwsRoot, AWS/S3, etc.)

hasNetflowEnabledDevices.description: Whether if any Netflow enabled devices in this device group

id.description: The id of the device group

name.description: The name of the device group

numOfAWSDevices.description: The number of AWS devices that belong to this device group (includes AWS devices in sub groups)

numOfAzureDevices.description: The number of Azure devices that belong to this device group (includes Azure devices in sub groups)

numOfDirectDevices.description: The number of AWS and normal devices that belong only to this device group (doesn't include devices in sub-groups)

numOfDirectSubGroups.description: The number of sub-groups that belong only to this device group (doesn't include groups under sub-groups)

numOfHosts.description: The number of total devices, including both AWS and normal devices, that belong to this device group (includes normal devices in sub groups)

parentId.description: The id of the parent group for this device group (the root device group has an Id of 1)

subGroups.description: The child device groups within this device group

userPermission.description: The permissions for the device group that are granted to the user that made this API request

appliesTo.description: The Applies to custom query for this group (only for dynamic groups)

awsRegionsInfo.description: The number of instances in each AWS region (only applies to AWS groups)

azureRegionsInfo.description: The number of instances in each Azure region (only applies to Azure groups)

description.description: The description of the device group

fullPath.description: The full path of the device group (i.e. if the group 'Dev' is under a parent group named 'Production', the fullPath would be 'Production/Dev'

groupType.description: The type of device group: normal and dynamic device groups will have groupType=Normal, and AWS groups will have a groupType value of AWS/SERVICE (e.g. AWS/S3)

id.description: The id of the device group

name.description: The name of the device group

numOfDirectDevices.description: The number of AWS and normal devices that belong only to this device group (doesn't include devices in sub-groups)

numOfDirectSubGroups.description: The number of sub-groups that belong only to this device group (doesn't include groups under sub-groups)

numOfHosts.description: The number of total devices, including both AWS and normal devices, that belong to this device group (includes normal devices in sub groups)

userPermission.description: The permissions for the device group that are granted to the user that made this API request

info.description: LogicMonitor is a SaaS-based performance monitoring platform that provides full visibility into complex, hybrid infrastructures, offering granular performance monitoring and actionable data and insights. logicmonitor_sdk enables you to manage your LogicMonitor account programmatically.
info.title: LogicMonitor REST API
